column4: it look like this should install it sudo apt-get install lm-sensors
it doesn't work
I have downloaded the tar.gz, I'm going to install it via terminal, but I need some additional files to make it work. Since I'm a newb.. I can't find them.. could you hep me ?
what error do you get from sudo apt-get install lm-sensors ?
try sudo sensors-detect
and see https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SensorInstallHowto
from that I would guess it's working then
you can now install one of the gui apps or applets to view it on your screen
but I can't find sensors-applet
I want it to show on my panel
did you install it?
yes
if so what error did you get from that install sudo apt-get install  sensors-applet
I don't get any errors, but I can't find it ?
what are you looking for that you can't find?
sensors-applet.
How can I make it show my computer temperature on my panel ?

read the link as it point out Finally, restart to load all the sensors. Once back at the desktop,  right-click on the top panel and choose "Add to Panel." Select "Hardware  Sensors Monitor" and click the "Add" button,
but you should read above that as well
maybe that applet is too old?
can I PM you ?
if so try ksensors
